Articles.Content:
Orbital Express going to it's suicide mission to Mun Minimus and beyond.

I recorded a lot more than 34 minutes of the film, but for now I decided to do scene with only far off, I used IVONA speech synthesizer, then I converted the files that I created in audacity to give a more high-pitched tone voices.

uh..... I'm really not sure how to respond to this. I would suggest that if you're making videos consider pressing F2 to hide all the HUD, because if I'm watching a video, the last thing I want to see is the GUI and all the mechjeb windows. I know you probably find it easier to let mechjeb fly the ship for you with them there, but people watching videos tend to want to see what's going on, especially since some of those windows are unnecessary in this video.

Also, that countdown to launch had me in stitches, although possibly not in the way you intended You might want to hae a wee peek at the sound settings for the voices. (try and get your 10, 9, 8,7 in time as well) They sound a little... strange. If it's possible to raise the pitch without speeding them up, that might be worth a shot. Alternatively, for a better effect, find a few helium baloons and inhale some helium before recording.

Apart from that, good video, I like the music, Apollo 13 'the launch' isn't it?

uh..... I'm really not sure how to respond to this. I would suggest that if you're making videos consider pressing F2 to hide all the HUD, because if I'm watching a video, the last thing I want to see is the GUI and all the mechjeb windows. I know you probably find it easier to let mechjeb fly the ship for you with them there, but people watching videos tend to want to see what's going on, especially since some of those windows are unnecessary in this video.

Also, that countdown to launch had me in stitches, although possibly not in the way you intended You might want to hae a wee peek at the sound settings for the voices. (try and get your 10, 9, 8,7 in time as well) They sound a little... strange. If it's possible to raise the pitch without speeding them up, that might be worth a shot. Alternatively, for a better effect, find a few helium baloons and inhale some helium before recording.

Apart from that, good video, I like the music, Apollo 13 'the launch' isn't it?

Yes this is Apollo 13 soundtrack, but as regards the voice, it was not my voice, but IVONA speech synthesizer, by the way very cool program

http://www.ivona.com/en/
Congratulations on figuring out how to make and post a movie. I want to learn how to do that, but so far I've been intimidated. Or many lazy. I liked the voices, too.

Congratulations on figuring out how to make and post a movie. I want to learn how to do that, but so far I've been intimidated. Or many lazy. I liked the voices, too.

It's IVONA Speech Synthesizer can be downloaded from internet, i processed the recorded voices from synthesizer in Audacity to make voices more hi-pitched.

You can also watch this

I used voices from this video it's TV miniseries "From the Earth to The Moon"

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ryEgx5iOdOA
You've got your own little documentary series going.
